pageContext.claim: “It was the worst recovery in the history of our country. And Obama threw tremendous money at it.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump neglects to mention that the Troubled Assets Relief Program, which infused $700 billion into the U.S. economy in response to the 2008 financial crisis, was signed into law by President George W. Bush. President Barack Obama later expanded this stimulus. The economic recovery under Obama was the slowest since World War II, but it doesn't come close to being as slow as the 10-year lull caused by the Great Depression.
